slokas: अर्जुन उवाचप्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव क्षेत्रं क्षेत्रज्ञमेव च ।एतद्वेदितुमिच्छामि ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं च केशव ॥ १ ॥
slokas_translated: Arjuna said: O Kesava, I wish to understand about Prakriti (nature), Purusha (the enjoyer), and the field and the knower of the field, and the knowledge and the object of knowledge.

slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचइदं शरीरं कौन्तेय क्षेत्रमित्यभिधीयते ।एतद्यो वेत्ति तं प्राहु: क्षेत्रज्ञ इति तद्विद: ॥ २ ॥
slokas_translated: The Supreme Lord said: This body, O son of Kunti, is called the field, and one who knows this body is called the knower of the field.

slokas: क्षेत्रज्ञं चापि मां विद्धि सर्वक्षेत्रेषु भारत ।क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोर्ज्ञानं यत्तज्ज्ञानं मतं मम ॥ ३ ॥
slokas_translated: Know Me to be the Knower of the field in all fields, O Arjuna. Knowledge of the field and its Knower is deemed by Me to be true knowledge.

slokas: तत्क्षेत्रं यच्च‍ यादृक्‍च यद्विकारि यतश्च यत् ।स च यो यत्प्रभावश्च तत्समासेन मे श‍ृणु ॥ ४ ॥
slokas_translated: Listen to me in brief, O son of Kunti, and know that I am the knower in all fields of activities.

slokas: ऋषिभिर्बहुधा गीतं छन्दोभिर्विविधै: पृथक् ।ब्रह्मसूत्रपदैश्चैव हेतुमद्भ‍िर्विनिश्चितै: ॥ ५ ॥
slokas_translated: The reasons for the various hymns sung by the sages in many ways, the different meters, and the Brahmasutras are all determined by logical reasoning.

slokas: महाभूतान्यहङ्कारो बुद्धिरव्यक्तमेव च ।इन्द्रियाणि दशैकं च पञ्च चेन्द्रियगोचरा: ॥ ६ ॥
slokas_translated: The great elements, ego, intellect, the unmanifested, the ten senses, and the five sense objects.

slokas: इच्छा द्वेष: सुखं दु:खं सङ्घातश्चेतना धृति: ।एतत्क्षेत्रं समासेन सविकारमुदाहृतम् ॥ ७ ॥
slokas_translated: Desire, aversion, pleasure, pain, the body, consciousness, and determination - this is called the field with its modifications.

slokas: अमानित्वमदम्भित्वमहिंसा क्षान्तिरार्जवम् ।आचार्योपासनं शौचं स्थैर्यमात्मविनिग्रह: ॥ ८ ॥
slokas_translated: Humility, non-pretentiousness, non-violence, patience, straightforwardness, service to the teacher, cleanliness, stability, self-control.

slokas: इन्द्रियार्थेषु वैराग्यमनहङ्कार एव च ।जन्ममृत्युजराव्याधिदु:खदोषानुदर्शनम् ॥ ९ ॥
slokas_translated: Detachment from sense objects and absence of pride; reflecting on the defects of birth, death, old age, sickness, and pain.

slokas: असक्तिरनभिष्वङ्ग: पुत्रदारगृहादिषु ।नित्यं च समचित्तत्वमिष्टानिष्टोपपत्तिषु ॥ १० ॥
slokas_translated: Non-attachment to son, wife, home, etc., and constantly even-mindedness amidst desired and undesired events.

slokas: मयि चानन्ययोगेन भक्तिरव्यभिचारिणी ।विविक्तदेशसेवित्वमरतिर्जनसंसदि ॥ ११ ॥
slokas_translated: In me alone is devotion that is unwavering, practiced in solitude, and disinterested in the company of people.

slokas: अध्यात्मज्ञाननित्यत्वं तत्त्वज्ञानार्थदर्शनम् ।एतज्ज्ञानमिति प्रोक्तमज्ञानं यदतोऽन्यथा ॥ १२ ॥
slokas_translated: The eternal nature of spiritual knowledge is to see the purpose of knowledge of the Truth. That which is contrary to this is said to be ignorance.

slokas: ज्ञेयं यत्तत्प्रवक्ष्यामि यज्ज्ञात्वामृतमश्न‍ुते ।अनादिमत्परं ब्रह्म न सत्तन्नासदुच्यते ॥ १३ ॥
slokas_translated:
I will now explain the text in English. The translation of the Sanskrit text you provided is:

"What is to be known, I will tell you, knowing which, one attains immortality. The supreme Brahman is without a beginning, and is said to be neither being nor non-being." (Bhagavad Gita 13.13)

slokas: सर्वत: पाणिपादं तत्सर्वतोऽक्षिशिरोमुखम् ।सर्वत:श्रुतिमल्ल‍ोके सर्वमावृत्य तिष्ठति ॥ १४ ॥
slokas_translated: Everywhere are His hands and legs, His eyes, heads, and faces, and He hears everything in the universe.

slokas: सर्वेन्द्रियगुणाभासं सर्वेन्द्रियविवर्जितम् ।असक्तं सर्वभृच्च‍ैव निर्गुणं गुणभोक्तृ च ॥ १५ ॥
slokas_translated: Manifesting through the qualities of all the senses, yet devoid of all the senses; unattached, sustaining all, without qualities, and the experiencer of qualities.

slokas: बहिरन्तश्च भूतानामचरं चरमेव च ।सूक्ष्मत्वात्तदविज्ञेयं दूरस्थं चान्तिके च तत् ॥ १६ ॥
slokas_translated: The Supreme Soul exists both inside and outside all living beings, moving and unmoving. It is subtle and inconceivable, far away yet near.

slokas: अविभक्तं च भूतेषु विभक्तमिव च स्थितम् ।भूतभर्तृ च तज्ज्ञेयं ग्रसिष्णु प्रभविष्णु च ॥ १७ ॥
slokas_translated: Indivisible and yet existing in all beings, it appears divided. It is to be known as the sustainer of beings and also the devourer and creator.

slokas: ज्योतिषामपि तज्ज्योतिस्तमस: परमुच्यते ।ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं ज्ञानगम्यं हृदि सर्वस्य विष्ठितम् ॥ १८ ॥
slokas_translated: Even the light of lights, beyond darkness, is said to be the supreme knowledge, the knowable, the goal of knowledge, seated in the hearts of all.

slokas: इति क्षेत्रं तथा ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं चोक्तं समासत: ।मद्भ‍क्त एतद्विज्ञाय मद्भ‍ावायोपपद्यते ॥ १९ ॥
slokas_translated: Thus the field, knowledge, and the object to be known have been described succinctly. Knowing this, My devotee attains My nature.

slokas: प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव विद्ध्यनादी उभावपि ।विकारांश्च गुणांश्चैव विद्धि प्रकृतिसम्भवान् ॥ २० ॥
slokas_translated: Know that both nature and the individual soul are without beginning. Understand that all transformations and qualities arise from nature.

slokas: कार्यकारणकर्तृत्वे हेतु: प्रकृतिरुच्यते ।पुरुष: सुखदु:खानां भोक्तृत्वे हेतुरुच्यते ॥ २१ ॥
slokas_translated: In the causality of work and cause, the cause is said to be nature. In the enjoyment of pleasure and pain, the enjoyer is said to be the individual.

slokas: पुरुष: प्रकृतिस्थो हि भुङ्क्ते प्रकृतिजान्गुणान् ।कारणं गुणसङ्गोऽस्य सदसद्योनिजन्मसु ॥ २२ ॥
slokas_translated: The individual, situated in material nature, experiences the modes born of material nature. Attachment to the modes is the cause of his birth in good and evil wombs.

slokas: उपद्रष्टानुमन्ता च भर्ता भोक्ता महेश्वर: ।परमात्मेति चाप्युक्तो देहेऽस्मिन्पुरुष: पर: ॥ २३ ॥
slokas_translated: The seer, the supporter, the enjoyer, the great lord, and the supreme self, also called the purusha, resides within this body.

slokas: य एवं वेत्ति पुरुषं प्रकृतिं च गुणै: सह ।सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि न स भूयोऽभिजायते ॥ २४ ॥
slokas_translated: He who understands the nature of the individual and the gunas together, even though engaged in all kinds of activities, does not become entangled.

slokas: ध्यानेनात्मनि पश्यन्ति केचिदात्मानमात्मना ।अन्ये सांख्येन योगेन कर्मयोगेन चापरे ॥ २५ ॥
slokas_translated: Some perceive the self within themselves by meditation; others by the Sankhya yoga; and others by Karma yoga.

slokas: अन्ये त्वेवमजानन्त: श्रुत्वान्येभ्य उपासते ।तेऽपि चातितरन्त्येव मृत्युं श्रुतिपरायणा: ॥ २६ ॥
slokas_translated: Others, not knowing this, worship other gods after hearing of them. They also cross beyond death, being devoted to the rituals described in the scriptures.

slokas: यावत्सञ्जायते किञ्चित्सत्त्वं स्थावरजङ्गमम् ।क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञसंयोगात्तद्विद्धि भरतर्षभ ॥ २७ ॥
slokas_translated: As long as there is a living being in this world, O Arjuna, know that it is a combination of the field and the knower of the field.

slokas: समं सर्वेषु भूतेषु तिष्ठन्तं परमेश्वरम् ।विनश्यत्स्वविनश्यन्तं य: पश्यति स पश्यति ॥ २८ ॥
slokas_translated: He sees truly who sees the Supreme Lord existing equally in all beings that are perishable in the imperishable.

slokas: समं पश्यन्हि सर्वत्र समवस्थितमीश्वरम् ।न हिनस्त्यात्मनात्मानं ततो याति परां गतिम् ॥ २९ ॥
slokas_translated: Beholding the Lord equally present everywhere, one does not harm the self by the self. Thereby, one attains the highest goal.

slokas: प्रकृत्यैव च कर्माणि क्रियमाणानि सर्वश: ।य: पश्यति तथात्मानमकर्तारं स पश्यति ॥ ३० ॥
slokas_translated: Actions are performed by the body, mind, intellect, and senses of the individual, but he whose self is detached from all these actions, sees the reality.

slokas: यदा भूतपृथग्भावमेकस्थमनुपश्यति ।तत एव च विस्तारं ब्रह्म सम्पद्यते तदा ॥ ३१ ॥
slokas_translated: When one sees the variety of beings as abiding in the One, and spreading from That alone, then one attains Brahman.

slokas: अनादित्वान्निर्गुणत्वात्परमात्मायमव्यय: ।शरीरस्थोऽपि कौन्तेय न करोति न लिप्यते ॥ ३२ ॥
slokas_translated: Due to being unbeginning and attributeless, the Supreme Self is imperishable. Even though situated in the body, O Arjuna, it neither acts nor is tainted.

slokas: यथा सर्वगतं सौक्ष्म्यादाकाशं नोपलिप्यते ।सर्वत्रावस्थितो देहे तथात्मा नोपलिप्यते ॥ ३३ ॥
slokas_translated: Just as the all-pervading space is not tainted by any impurity, similarly the self, situated everywhere in the body, is not tainted.

slokas: यथा प्रकाशयत्येक: कृत्स्‍नं लोकमिमं रवि: ।क्षेत्रं क्षेत्री तथा कृत्स्‍नं प्रकाशयति भारत ॥ ३४ ॥
slokas_translated: As the sun illuminates the entire world, so does the soul illuminate the entire body, O Arjuna.

slokas: क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोरेवमन्तरं ज्ञानचक्षुषा ।भूतप्रकृतिमोक्षं च ये विदुर्यान्ति ते परम् ॥ ३५ ॥
slokas_translated: Those who know the difference between the field and the knower of the field, along with knowledge, they attain liberation from material nature; such individuals reach the supreme.
